column4: Why does output such as THIS: http://pastebin.com/d696025c  --- Not go to STDERR but instead to the terminal directly!?! It's hell of annoying if you can't pipe the error to less and stuff? Is that a nasty ubuntu thing??
because the error is NOT send to stderr!
The order is important. If 2>&1 is before >file.log, then stderr will be sent to the terminal
i tried that, it does NOT redirect the error!
Hm. Then glibc is writing directly to the terminal, not via the shell.
I'm telling you, the error is send to the tty directly - there is no way of redirecting it
Well, when you get a message from glibc, your program is doing something terribly wrong. The best would be to fix the program.
The only way I know to handle output going directly to terminal, is expect
I'm not proficient enough with expect to help you though, so you'll have to google or try #expect or #tcl (if they exist)
Gnea i included <stdio.h> but still the error is send to the terminal
The easy fix is to set the variable to NULL right after doing a free. free(NULL) is safe.
it's not about my program. I wrote this program to throw the error in order to fix the issue with glibc.
